content:
@WG-prioritization/alerts issue #88586 has been requested for prioritization.

Procedure

  • Priority?
  • Regression?
  • Notify people/groups?
  • Needs I-nominated?
Not entirely sure. For one, I'm not sure if this should have been an error to begin with. But nonetheless, it's really simple code, so "easy" to hit

yeah, I think so.

By the way @Noah Lev you marked this issue to the 1.55 milestone. Does it imply that a fix will be included in 1.55?
No, it means that the regression is in 1.55.
I think that's what we use the milestones to mean at least.

Noah Lev said:

I think that's what we use the milestones to mean at least.

As you can see I'm still confused, too :)
So regressions are marked with the version they regressed in, and PRs are (automatically) marked with the version they landed in.
We should ask T-release to make sure.

I went back to rust 1.38, the suggestion changed during releases but was never really helpful.

how broken is the sample code and easy to hit such malformed code? I was thinking a P-low but P-medium if I'm missing something obvious
I mean, I don't think that code example is broken, in theory. I think it's satisfiable if Self: 'static, though I think we've shied away from formally stating that
That being said, I'm not sure writing this code is useful for anything
It would interesting if this was a minimization of a more general problem
I would suggest P-medium because the MCVE is so small and fairly simple, and this is an error -> ICE.
